revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

[[Category:Quests]][[Category:Player vs Monster]] __TOC__ =Description= Message in a Bottle (MIB) [[Image:Bottle_of_ale.gif]] is the [[Treasure Map]] of the high seas. When you look inside the bottle, you will find either a Waterstained SOS [[File:Waterstained_sos.png]] or, less commonly, an Ancient SOS [[File:Ancient_sos.png]]. Within the message, you will find coordinates to a [[Message_in_a_Bottle#Sunken Treasure Chests|Sunken Treasure Chest]]. You will need at least 80 [[Fishing]] to have a chance of pulling up the chest. Some patience may be required to fish up the chest, you may find many an old boot before you hit the jackpot. Using a [[Bent rod]] will pull up the treasure chest without pulling up junk items first. It is generally recommended that you collect a few MIBs and then group them up by location before sailing out. =Sunken Treasure Chests= Sunken Treasure Chests have 3 levels of loot which are randomly chosen when fished up starting at 80 [[Fishing|Fishing Skill]]. Ancient Sunken Treasure Chests always contain level 4 loot. Both chests will be trapped even if found unlocked. All chests have a low chance for a [[Random_Dungeon_Adventure#Fragments| Portal Fragment]] and always come with a type of [[Special Fishing Net]] which can also show up as one of the many available [[Special_Fishing_Net#Colors| special colors]]. The Sunken Treasure Chest is also an item in the game you get to keep and has been found in the various [[Paragons#Paragon_Chest_Hues|Paragon Chest Hues]], and as of recently other colors have been found for the Ancient Sunken Treasure Chests.

The following items can be found in either chest: * Gold * Gems * Scrolls * [[Reagents]] * [[Armor]] * [[Weapons]] * [[Wands]] - a very high chance for [[Item_Identification#Item_Identification_Wand|Item Identification Wands]] * [[Random_Dungeon_Adventure#Fragments|RDA Fragments]] - 1% chance to drop. Note that these portal fragments share the same graphic ID as star sapphires but have a different hue (1161). * [[Meta_Talismans#Relic_Qualities|Crumbling Relics]] or [[Meta_Pets#Relic_Qualities|Crumbling Relics]]
